nodes.text: An IoT-based home automation system can provide low-cost, wireless, remotely and automatically controlled management of home appliances to improve energy performance, accessibility, and user convenience
Design and implementation of firmware and a networked prototype can minimize human interaction and automate control of multiple home electrical devices
An Android application with switch mode and voice mode can act as a client to send control commands over sockets to the home automation prototype
The developed prototype is economical, simple, expandable, scalable, and usable from any WiFi-capable device (Android, iOS, PC)

Home automation systems provide energy efficiency, improved security, and increased comfort, and are particularly beneficial for elderly and disabled users but are limited in uptake by complexity and cost
Prototype implementation includes a wireless remote switching system for home appliances and displays each device status in the smartphone app
The system was designed to be highly scalable to allow adding and integrating additional functions and devices
Firmware and control logic were developed to automate appliance control and preserve device integrity by minimizing manual interaction
Switch mode uses radio buttons in the app to send on/off state commands; voice mode captures microphone input, sends to Google servers, receives text, parses it, and issues commands
Control commands are sent over WiFi using socket programming and are secured using SSL over TCP or SSH
Because the system uses common technologies and simple design, it can be implemented in homes, small offices, and shopping centers for remote or intranet device management
The prototype provides an indoor radio control range of approximately 150 feet when using WiFi
Hardware and software components include Arduino UNO R3, Bluetooth module HC 05, relay module, PCB, wires, power supply, WiFi, Arduino IDE and a server
Related work demonstrates IoT home automation implementations using NodeMCU, MQTT brokers, Raspberry Pi servers, voice assistants, sensors, and emphasizes energy efficiency and security
The prototype supports voice and app-based remote switching, status monitoring, and control from any WiFi-enabled device, demonstrating feasibility of the proposed approach
